abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Social
            Protection Project of Panama are to: (1) improve the
            management and operation of the conditional cash transfer
            program to enhance its effectiveness in reaching the poorest
            and indigenous groups; (2) provide beneficiaries with an
            incentive framework to increase their participation in the
            conditional cash transfers (CCT) program, which would boost
            their demand for education and maternal and infant health
            services; (3) strengthen the supply of nutrition and child
            growth promotion interventions in the indigenous areas of
            the Red de Oportunidades Program (RO); and (4) enhance
            government capacity to develop coherent and efficient social
            sector policies and interventions on the basis of evidence.
            This restructuring paper seeks the approval of the Country
            Director for Panama to introduce the changes described below
            to the project. Three changes are there for the project. The
            first change is to reallocate resources across components
            from those with slower execution due to institutional
            constraints to those closely associated with the operational
            implementation of the conditional cash transfer RO. This
            will allow sufficient resources for the management,
            monitoring and evaluation of the RO and for support to
            health care promotion interventions in indigenous areas.
            Changes in the category of expenses also include the
            elimination of counterpart contribution requirement in
            Operating Costs and the inclusion of eligible operating
            cost. The elimination of the counterpart contribution will
            be effective retroactively to January 1, 2011. The second
            change is to extend the closing date for 18 months from the
            original closing date of June 30, 2012 to December 31, 2013,
            to allow for the completion of the impact evaluation of RO
            and the basic health and nutrition services coverage
            expansion strategy. The third change is to revise the
            results framework and monitoring/indicators, including the
            revision of one of the outcome indicators targets for the
            Project Development Objective (PDO) due to more accurate
            estimates obtained during supervision. The PDOs are not
            affected by these changes. The delays in implementation have
            resulted in the need to change some of the results
            indicators and to drop others. The results framework and
            monitoring matrix has detailed information about these
            changes. Reallocation of the loan proceeds is necessary to
            align the financial resources to the revisions to project
            activities. In this restructuring, some of the funds allocated.
